intro: Euphrasia gautieri, commonly known as the Gautier's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem. Euphrasia gautieri is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
